column5: Hello All,  I have recently registered and have read a few posts. Looks like a great bunch. I just wanted to give a quick intro being new to the board.  I have been fishing for only a couple of years and learning lots. Primarly fish bass and pike but also fish for rainbows and accassionally go down rigging a few times with a friend. Getting anxious to get out fishing with spring approaching.  Hopefully I will be able to contribute as my experience grows but in the meantime I appreciate information that is being posted.  Steve
Welcome aboard Steve.  Mike

Top of the evening to ya ... welcome to the board.  I too share your enjoyment for bass and pike fishing.  yup - the season is just around the corner now.  Best of luck to ya and post some pics of those beauties.
Welcome to our OFC family SteveK.
Welcome to the OFNCommunity!!   Bly
Welcome.
welcome
Great introduction!  Look forward to your posts and welcome SteveK.
A Hearty AttaBoy to SteveK.  What Jen said.  And Welcome, also.
Hello Steve..Welcome to OFC
Welcome to the zoo, you picked a good time to join us with spring right around the corner  Maureen
Steve,  You'll love it here!  If you need tips, you'll get em!  This really is a family here...actually bly (who posted above) is my wife, so it's really is family...LOL.
Let me be amung the first to say welcome aboard to our board..hehe.  A little boat humor there.
Welcome and enjoy!
Welcome, where do you live and fish?  Tony

Thank you all for the warm response.  I am from the Kitchenr-Waterloo area. Although I spend a lot of time fishing in the the Grey-Bruce area, I have heard of a few opportunities in my own region that I will need to check out.  Good fishing to all this spring. Hope I will be able to share a few pics.  Steve
Welcome to the board Steve, great bunch here!  Barn
Welcome to the board Steve.  Look forward to your reports.
Welcome! I'm also from the K-W area!
Welcome Steve.
Cool, look forward to your reports!  Tony
Welcome
Welcome Steve.  You'll love it here.  Joey
Welcome to the OFC Community. Take yer shoes off an stay a mite.
